segments.text: Okay , now I ’ d like to find out more about your last job . I see you spent almost four years at the London Weekly , is that right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , that ’ s right . To be honest , the first year was quite tough for me . I was really just treated more like an intern . I didn ’ t have many responsibilities and I found it quite frustrating .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well slowly but surely I proved myself , and the new editor liked me so he promoted me to features writer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I was responsible for restaurant and food reviews mostly . I spent 3 years in that position , but to be honest it wasn ’ t an area of journalism I wanted to stay in long-term .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see , so why did you decide to leave finally ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I just felt that the paper couldn ’ t offer me any new opportunities . I really needed a more challenging role to be honest .
segments.speaker: S2
